newsitem.title: CHINA: China calls for regulation of funds industry.
newsitem.headline: China calls for regulation of funds industry.

text.p: Chinese financial authorities have called for regulations to govern the nation's fledgling funds industry, the China Daily said on Wednesday.
Financial authorities needed to strengthen their ability to supervise the industry, it quoted Vice Governor of the People's Bank of China Yin Jieyan as saying.
Authorities were reviewing two regulations, one on securities-investment fund management and one on Sino-foreign fund management companies, it said.
It did not say when the new regulations might be completed.
Financial specialists suggested that treasury bond funds be set up in the near future to speed the development of open-end funds. Almost all funds in China are closed-end, it said.
Greater quantities and varieties of treasury bonds and improved issuing and trading procedures were needed to promote treasury bond funds.
China has issued a record 180 billion yuan ($21.6 billion) of treasury debt this year.
